summary: The mountain town of Asheville was largely cut off due to flooding with supplies being airlifted to residents.

summary: 58 patients and staff were left stranded on the roof of a hospital in the city of Erwin due to flooding and were later rescued by helicopters.

summary: At least 8 people have died in Florida since Friday including at least 5 people in the coastal Pinellas County.
event-picture-caption: Flooding in Florida

summary: At least 15 people have died in Georgia including a first responder and 1000 National Guard troops have been deployed to help with rescue efforts.

summary: At least 17 people have been killed in South Carolina.

summary: At least 7 people have died in North Carolina and more than 100 rescues have taken place.

summary: At least 1 person has died in Virginia.

summary: Hurricane Helene is expected to make landfall in the Big Bend region of Florida posing a 'nightmare surge scenario for Apalachee Bay.' The storm's center is forecast to make landfall late Thursday or early Friday morning with sustained winds of 105 mph and a large wind field that will bring impacts across much of the state.
event-picture-caption: Jerry McCullen top of ladder left and Carson Baze top of ladder right put plywood over the windows of a house ahead of Hurricane Helene in Alligator Point Fla.

summary: Residents in Alligator Point Florida are preparing for the arrival of Hurricane Helene with some boarding up their homes and others evacuating the area.
event-picture-caption: Paulette McLin takes in the scene outside their summer home ahead of Hurricane Helene in Alligator Point Fla.

summary: Parts of South Florida including Fort Lauderdale recorded wind gusts as high as 55 mph Wednesday night and one reported gust early Thursday at 64 mph as Helene's strong outer bands began to move through the region.

summary: Water lapped over a road in Siesta Key near Sarasota and covered some intersections in St. Pete Beach.

summary: The Gulf of Mexico's water pushes up against the beach as Hurricane Helene churns offshore.

summary: Heavy rains began falling and winds were picking up earlier Thursday in Valdosta Georgia near the Florida state line.
event-picture-caption: Heavy Rain in Valdosta

summary: Two people were killed when a possible tornado struck a mobile home on Thursday night Wheeler County Sheriff Randy Rigdon told WMAZ-TV.
event-picture-caption: Tornado in Wheeler County

summary: Anthony Godwin 20 who lives about a half-mile from the water in the coastal town of Panacea stopped for gas before heading west toward his sister's house in Pensacola.
event-picture-caption: Flooding in Panacea

summary: Hurricane Helene is expected to hit Mexico and its beaches. A Hurricane Warning is in effect for Cabo Catoche to Tulum Mexico including Cozumel. Helene is expected to produce total rain accumulations of 4 to 8 inches over western Cuba the Cayman Islands and the northeast Yucatan Peninsula with isolated totals around 12 inches bringing a risk of considerable flooding.
event-picture-caption: Hurricane Helene path

summary: Hurricane Helene is expected to make landfall in Florida with over 40 million people in three US states currently under storm warnings. The storm is expected to produce a 15 foot (4.6 meter) rise in the sea level due to storm conditions with 15 inches (38.1 centimeters) of rain foreseen for some parts of the region.
event-picture-caption: Tropical Storm Helene was upgraded to hurricane status as it passed over the Gulf of Mexico

summary: Numerous evacuations are being ordered along Florida's Gulf coast including in the counties of Sarasota and Charlotte. Dozens of other counties in the US' southeastern-most state announced school closures due to hurricane and tropical storm warnings.
event-picture-caption: People in Florida filled up sandbags on Wednesday ahead of Helene's predicted arrival the next day

summary: Officials in Pinellas County which lies on a peninsula surrounded by the Tampa Bay and the Gulf of Mexico ordered evacuations of long-term healthcare facilities including nursing homes assisted living centers and hospitals near the coast.
event-picture-caption: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis said in a Tuesday press briefing that residents should prepare and review their hurricane plan

summary: Hurricane Helene is expected to make landfall in Florida on Thursday evening with tropical storm conditions expected in southern and eastern parts of the state. Disney World has announced that Typhoon Lagoon will be closed on Thursday September 26th.
event-picture-caption: Hurricane Helene

summary: Hurricane Helene has quickly intensified into a massive Category 4 storm with hurricane-force winds extending up to 60 miles outward from the eye. Forecasters warn that Helene could be deadly for those living in coastal Florida where itâ€™s expected to make landfall this evening.
event-picture-caption: An NOAA satellite image from early Thursday morning shows Hurricane Helene approaching the Florida coast.

summary: Hurricane Helene is forecast to track along Florida's Gulf coast late Wednesday and into Thursday as a large storm with widespread impacts. The shoreline and waterways are vulnerable to storm surge.
event-picture-caption: Live webcams show Hurricane Helene's impacts on Florida coast

summary: Hurricane Helene is set to make landfall in Florida causing Disney's Typhoon Lagoon and miniature golf courses to close on September 26th. The rest of Disney World is operating with regular hours but this could change as the hurricane progresses.
event-picture-caption: Typhoon Lagoon

summary: Helene is expected to make landfall as a Category 4 hurricane with maximum sustained winds of 209km/h (130mph). The storm is anticipated to be unusually large and fast-moving meaning storm surges wind and rain will likely extend several hundred kilometres from the storm's centre.
event-picture-caption: Tropical Storm Helene off the Gulf Coast of Florida near Mexico and Cuba on September 24 2024

summary: The strong winds knocked out power in the Cayman Islands where heavy rain and waves reached as high as three metres (10 feet).
Many in Cuba worried about the storm whose outer bands are expected to reach the capital of Havana which is already struggling with chronic power outages.
Some residents along the Gulf Coast in Florida's Panhandle are already evacuating to safer areas inland with memories still fresh of recent storm surge events.
event-picture-caption: Dave McCurley boards up the windows to his home in advance of Tropical Storm Helene expected to make landfall as a hurricane in Ochlockonee Bay Florida Wednesday September 25 2024

summary: Hurricane Helene is expected to bring life-threatening storm surge damaging winds and flooding rains to a large portion of Florida and the southeast U.S.
event-picture-caption: Satellite footage of the hurricane moving toward Florida.

summary: A user in Albany GA reported waiting out the storm with 2 inches of rain so far and the storm still 250 miles south of them.
event-picture-caption: A map showing where the hurricane warning is in effect.

summary: Hurricane Helene is forecasted to strike Florida as a major Category 3 hurricane. Walt Disney World has announced closures cancellations and adjustments as a result of the storm.
event-picture-caption: Hurricane Helene

summary: Typhoon Lagoon water park will be closed on September 26 2024 due to inclement weather.
event-picture-caption: Typhoon Lagoon

summary: The Mickey's Not So Scary Halloween Party happening the night of September 26 2024 at Magic Kingdom has been cancelled.

summary: Disney World and Universal Orlando are closing some of their water parks and other attractions due to the approach of Hurricane Helene. Busch Gardens in Tampa Bay has also decided to close for the day.

summary: Hurricane Helene is expected to bring storm surges of 15 to 20 feet above ground level in the worst-hit areas of the Big Bend.
The areas most likely to be affected by flooding extend northward from the Gulf Coast to the southern Appalachians where the threat will be at its highest.
Residents of Florida's Gulf Coast prepare for Hurricane Helene. Paulette McLin takes in the scene outside their summer home ahead of Hurricane Helene expected to make landfall Thursday evening.

summary: Hurricane Helene has forced Walt Disney World to suspend operations at several resort locations including Typhoon Lagoon Fantasia Gardens and Fairways and Winter Summerland miniature golf courses. Mickey's Not-So-Scary Halloween Party has also been canceled.

summary: Charlotte Douglas International Airport (CLT) experienced significant flight cancellations due to Hurricane Helene with about 190 departing flights and 205 inbound flights canceled as of Friday afternoon.

summary: Hurricane Ian made landfall near Cayo Costa Florida as a Category 4 storm with 150 mph sustained winds and an onslaught of rain and storm surges. The storm had severe impacts on the state's power grid with outages rising to 2.5 million in the state in the days following landfall.
event-picture-caption: Aerial view of damaged property after Hurricane Ian in Fort Myers Beach Fla.

summary: The city of Fort Myers experienced a 7.26-foot storm surge which became a record high according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

summary: Hurricane Ian made landfall near Cayo Costa Florida as a Category 4 storm with 150 mph sustained winds and an onslaught of rain and storm surges.

summary: Mandatory evacuations were ordered in Asheville and McDowell counties in North Carolina as rivers and reservoirs are expected to swell from heavy rainfall.

summary: The center of Helene which became post-tropical Friday afternoon was located about 50 miles south-southeast of Louisville Kentucky as of 5 p.m. EDT on Friday.

summary: Tallahassee prepares for 'historic event' as Helene closes in on Florida. Helene was forecast to become a dangerous Category 4 hurricane before it makes landfall in Florida's Big Bend area Thursday night. It could bring winds in excess of 130 mph life-threatening storm surge and flooding.
event-picture-caption: Pamela Andrews bags sand in preparation for possible flooding as Hurricane Helene heads toward the Florida Gulf Coast in Tallahassee on Wednesday.

summary: Leslie Powell 37 was getting ready to evacuate her mobile home in Quincy a city in Gadsden County about 25 miles northwest of Tallahassee with her 8-month-old baby and her 6-year-old daughter Wednesday afternoon.

summary: Hurricane Helene brought dangerous storm surge high winds and flooding rain to Florida causing thousands to lose power. The hardest hit counties were Taylor Dixie Suwannee and Madison with nearly all customers without power.

summary: The Big Bend area of Florida is expected to see a storm surge of up to 20ft (6m) of water inundating land.

summary: All public schools in Atlanta will close on Thursday and Friday due to the storm.
